name: biomni-query-arxiv
title: Biomni: Query Arxiv
description: Search arXiv for research papers based on the provided query. Returns paper titles and summaries sorted by relevance.
content:
Overview

Search arXiv preprint repository for research papers based on your query. arXiv is a free distribution service hosting preprints in physics, mathematics, computer science, quantitative biology, quantitative finance, statistics, electrical engineering, systems science, and economics. Results include paper titles, authors, abstracts, and publication metadata sorted by relevance.

Input Parameters

  • query (required): Search query string (e.g., "deep learning protein structure prediction")
  • max_papers (optional): Maximum number of papers to return (default: 10)

Biological Use Case

Essential for finding the latest preprints in computational biology, bioinformatics, and quantitative biology before formal journal publication. Use cases include: discovering cutting-edge methods before peer review, tracking work from specific research groups, finding recently posted machine learning approaches for biological data, identifying emerging trends in systems biology, and accessing papers that may not yet be available through traditional journal searches. arXiv papers are freely accessible and often represent the most current research in rapidly evolving fields.

Output

Returns a text file (arxiv_results.txt) containing formatted search results with paper titles, authors, publication dates, abstracts, arXiv IDs, and direct links to the papers. Results are sorted by relevance to the query.

Category

literature
